oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1946-02-16 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 16, 1946. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) and performers the Smoky Mountain Boys, the Old Hickory Singers, the Duke Of Paducah, Tommy Magness, Velma Williams, Bashful Brother Oswald, Minnie Pearl, and Mac McGar with Harold Bradley on guitar (as per Mr. Bradley 2006-08-14). Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Old Hickory Singers; Velma Williams; Bashful Brother Oswald; Minnie Pearl; Mac McGar; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Roy Acuff introduces Velma Williams and Bashful Brother Oswald -- Why Not Confess (Velma Williams, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Roy Acuff introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Roy Acuff introduces Mac McGar -- Black And White Rag (Mac McGar) -- Roy Acuff introduces his Smoky Mountain Boys and Velma Williams -- A Beautiful Home (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Velma Williams) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck) -- Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Birmingham Jail (Old Hickory Singers) -- Arkansas Traveler (Roy Acuff calls) -- Closing theme (Get Along Home Cindy) -- Closing statement -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Magness, Tommy; Williams, Velma; Bashful Brother Oswald; McGar, Mac; Bradley, Harold (Guitarist)
